intro: Phyllanthus rhodocladus, commonly known as the red-leaf phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring alternate, simple leaves that are often leathery and glossy. Its flowers are small and clustered, with male and female flowers often occurring on separate plants. The plant is also noted for its potential medicinal uses in traditional herbal remedies.
